alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Coastal Areas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued March 04 at 6:38AM PST until March 04 at 8:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST THIS MORNING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO NOON PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 4 to 7 feet with local sets to 8 feet. For the Beach Hazards Statement, isolated thunderstorms with cloud to ground lightning are expected. * WHERE...San Diego County Coastal Areas. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from noon today to noon PST Sunday. For the Beach Hazards Statement, until 8 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Lightning presents a particular hazard for beach goers.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.
